title: Arabic Content Creator - Saudi Arabia
content:
MediaMonks Middle East is looking for an Arabic Content Creator who can wield words comfortably in Saudi Arabian dialect, wisdom and wit as they cover everything from social content, web copy and newsletters to print, display advertising and e-commerce. If you’re keen to work as part of a global team, have a good understanding of Middle Eastern culture, specifically that of Saudi Arabia and keen to produce integrated work for a world-class client, this job represents the sweet spot. 
 
Living on-site as a part of the client team in Tabuk, Saudi Arabia, you will be the face of the Middle East Monastery, working with our ambitious client to build the first cognitive and smart city in the world. 

Role & Responsibilities
 

Working as part of a global group of talent on both local and international assignments, you’ll operate across teams and time zones on projects big and small.
Handle large-scale requests along with single lines of copy.
Specialise in creating digital content including website content, social content and display and video ad copy.
Use data-driven insights to help personalise content across the entire customer journey—from awareness campaigns to e-commerce copy.
Your writing ensures that the content is in line with the project’s specific objectives and the client’s even-more-specific expectations.
In addition to all kinds of user-facing content, you may also be required to produce copy decks and/or copy proposals.
Contribute to improving our workflows, best practices and client relationships across brands.
You will be required to create content in English on the go. 
You will also be required to adapt existing copy from English into Arabic, but not translate it
Your job is to ensure everything makes sense, is consistent, and meets the client’s objectives.

 
Requirements

We’re looking for an Arabic copywriter with 5+ years of experience and a knack for working at an international level.
You are familiar with the local and regional Arabic cultural scene, and how it translates through digital platforms, music, books etc… 
Your writing is both clear and compelling.
You have a keen pulse on everything on and offline, particularly Arabic content
You can produce quality content out of thin air as well as based on briefs or input written by others.
You know about the good, the bad and the ugly of programmatic advertising and behavioural targeting in order to write effective, dynamic copy.
You have a proven ability to tackle the same topic from a variety of angles
You combine creativity with critical thinking; your analytical approach means you ask the right questions and make sense of complex content and marketing strategies.
You’re comfortable and capable of presenting work to clients in English—always able to rationalize your choices and considerations to win people over with your words.
As part of a constructive feedback loop, you can give and handle critique without making it or taking it personally.
As a copy editor, you are the change you want to see in the word — you improve what is said, not just how.
Your attention to detail is close to annoying: typos, inconsistencies and questionable punctuation marks have little chance of getting past your cursor.
You’re comfortable jumping in and out at any stage of a project—from first ideas to final words—always delivering tight work, even under tight deadlines.
You have a great sense of personal responsibility and eagerly go the extra mile if that’s what it takes to make good great.


Big projects don’t scare you, and no task is too small for a rounded and well-executed content strategy.
You deeply care about effect and conversion while valuing the user’s time more than anything in the world.
You are in love with the Arabic language and can strategically piece it together to form an emotional copy just as well as  funny, short, and engaging digital content.
About Media.Monks:
Media.Monks is the purely digital operating brand of S4Capital plc that connects 8,600+ digital natives across one global team. We are united by a mission to shift industries forward and pave the path towards ambitious outcomes so our clients and our people can realize their full potential for growth. Our unified model combines solutions in media, data, social, platforms, studio, experience, brand and technology services to help our clients continuously reinvent themselves throughout increasingly rapid cycles of disruption. Our efforts to shape culture, build innovative technologies and unlock the future of growth have earned recognition from numerous esteemed panels: we maintain a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-22), regular recognition at Cannes Lions, inclusion in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players (2020-23), the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-23), a record number of FWAs, and have earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023. Together, these achievements solidify our experience in digital innovation, excellence in craft, and commitment to personal growth.
While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Media.Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://media.monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
Disclaimer: 


Responsible for resourcing and implementing security controls for your teams processes and systems


Responsible that all your personnel apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy

We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission. 

As a step in strengthening our hiring process, we invite you to voluntarily provide information that will help inform and improve our inclusion efforts.
